articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday called for the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol after he declared martial law only to reverse the move hours later, triggering the biggest political crisis in decades in Asia's fourth-largest economy.
articles.title: South Korean lawmakers call to impeach President Yoon after back-track on martial law

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syrian rebels advancing against government forces pushed close on Tuesday to the major city of Hama, rebels and a war monitor said, after their sudden capture of Aleppo last week rocked President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Syrian rebels advance close to Hama city, piling pressure on Assad and his allies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's top China policymaker on Wednesday said Chinese military threats would only drive the two sides further apart, as state media in the island's giant neighbour warned of a strong response to a U.S. visit by Taiwan's president.
articles.title: Taiwan says China's threats over president's US visit are counterproductive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: There are no grounds yet for negotiations on how to bring the war in Ukraine to an end, Russia said on Wednesday, in comments about peace talks that have become more frequent since Donald Trump won the U.S. presidential vote in November.
articles.title: Russia reiterates no ground for Ukraine talks, but mentioning them more often

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Tuesday for major reinforcement of sectors in eastern Ukraine of the 1,000-km (600-mile) front line, where Russian forces have made consistent gains in recent months.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for reinforcement of eastern front against Russian advances

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine and Chinese coastguards reported conflicting versions of a maritime confrontation around a contested shoal in the South China Sea, the latest row in a longstanding dispute between the two neighbours.
articles.title: Philippines, China trade accusations over confrontation in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Some 135 people were killed in a crush at a soccer stadium in southeast Guinea on Sunday, a local group of human rights organisations said, sharing an estimated death toll more than twice as high as the official toll of 56.
articles.title: Guinea rights groups say 135 killed in stadium crush

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and the United States clashed at the United Nations on Tuesday, accusing each other of supporting terrorism during a Security Council meeting convened over a sudden escalation of fighting in Syria.
articles.title: Russia, US clash at UN over escalation in Syria fighting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France is at a turning point due to uncertainty over the country's budget and the future of the government, Finance Minister Antoine Armand said on Tuesday.
articles.title: France at turning point amid budget uncertainty, finance minister says

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: Russian presidential aircraft and funds were used in a program that took children from occupied Ukrainian territories, stripped them of Ukrainian identity and placed them with Russian families, according to a report by Yale's School of Public Health.
articles.title: Putin-controlled aircraft deported Ukrainian children, US-backed research alleges
